required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Study of NXL104/Ceftazidime Versus Comparator in Adults With Complicated Urinary Tract Infections
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective, Multicenter, Investigator-blinded, Randomized, Comparative Study Estimate Safety, Tolerability, Efficacy of NXL104/Ceftazidime vs. Comparator Followed Appropriate Oral Therapy Treatment Complicated UTI Hosp Adults

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether NXL104 plus ceftazidime is effective in the treatment of complicated urinary tract infections as compared to a comparator group.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Microbiological Outcome at the Test of Cure (TOC) Visit
primary_outcome.description: Eradication: a uropathogen found at entry at >10^5 CFU/mL was reduced to <10^4 CFU/mL

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Outcome in Clinically Evaluable (CE) Patients at the End of Intravenous (IV) Therapy Visit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of IV therapy (4 to 14 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Cure: all or most pre-therapy signs and symptoms of the index infection had resolved and no additional antibiotic was required

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Outcome in CE Patients at the TOC Visit
secondary_outcome.description: Cure: all or most pre-therapy signs and symptoms of the index infection had resolved and no additional antibiotic was required

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Outcome in CE Patients at the Late Follow-up (LFU) Visit
secondary_outcome.description: Cure: all or most pre-therapy signs and symptoms of the index infection showed no evidence of resurgence and no additional antibiotic was required

secondary_outcome.measure: Microbiological Outcome in ME Patients at the End of IV Therapy Visit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of IV therapy (4 to 14 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Eradication: a uropathogen found at entry at >10^5 CFU/mL was reduced to <10^4 CFU/mL

secondary_outcome.measure: Microbiological Outcome in ME Patients at the LFU Visit
secondary_outcome.description: Sustained eradication: a uropathogen found at entry at >10^5 CFU/mL remained <10^4 CFU/mL

secondary_outcome.measure: Microbiological Outcome for the Urine Pathogen C. Koseri in ME Patients at the End of IV Therapy Visit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of IV therapy (4 to 14 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Eradication: a uropathogen found at entry at >10^5 CFU/mL was reduced to <10^4 CFU/mL

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Acute pyelonephritis or other complicated urinary tract infection due to gram negative pathogens
Exclusion Criteria:
- ileal loops or vesicoureteral reflux
- complete obstruction of any portion of urinary tract, perinephric or intrarenal abscess.
- fungal urinary tract infection
- permanent indirect catheter or nephrostomy unless removed within 48 hours of study entry
- history hypersensitivity to study medication

facility.name: Louisiana State University Health Services Ctr Shreveport
R. Adams Cowley Shock Trauma Center

participants_list.participants: Up to Late follow up (LFU) visit

baseline.population: Safety population included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: If a Study Site, or an investigator, requests permission to publish data from this study, any such publication (including oral presentations) is to be agreed with AstraZeneca prior to publication.
